attributes.action: Hold a referendum on whether to allow devolution plans to go ahead
attributes.additional_details: It's not fair that the goverment think they can make such a big decision about reforming our councils and our democratic election system without first asking the people if they even want this. This is too big a decision to simply think that goverment knows best. 'No taxation without representation'
attributes.background: To hold a referendum and to allow the people to have their say on whether they want these devolution plans to go ahead or not.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Require local referenda when introducing new unitary and strategic authorities
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/711000
